thread.title: Beachcombers beware: Avoid these sea creatures on the beach and in the surf
thread.title_full: Beachcombers beware: Avoid these sea creatures on the beach and in the surf

title: Beachcombers beware: Avoid these sea creatures on the beach and in the surf
text:
Sponsored Links By Cox Media Group National Content Desk 
It’s high season for the beach, and the National Ocean Service is reminding beachgoers, if they see a Portuguese man o’ war, a type of sea animal related to the jellyfish, not to touch it. It has a painful sting and can sting you “even weeks after having washed ashore.” Look, but never touch! Learn more about the Portuguese Man o' War: http://t.co/aJ3ypKFzgm pic.twitter.com/ptVGXc6VYu — NOAA's Ocean Service (@noaaocean) July 22, 2015 
And that’s not the only organism to avoid touching on the beach and under water. 
The National Ocean Service advises you to avoid these five sea creatures at the shore:
